attributes.action: Allow Mr and Mrs Mudada to be reunited with their children
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Zimbabwean couple fled their home country’s brutal regime to find refuge in Lincolnshire. 
The husband was beaten and tortured for speaking out against President Robert Mugabe, as part of the oppositon group the Movement for Democratic Change.

They came to the UK in 2004, in fear of their lives - but their children were not granted entry to the UK, as the parents' asylum application had not been approved.

The couple fear their children could be “raped, abused or even killed” back home after the UK Government refused to grant them entry to this country. 

The children - the youngest of which is nine - had been living with their grandmother in Harare but have been left to fend for themselves after she died in 2005. They haven’t seen their parents for two years.

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
